DOC.brief_title: Trans Radial Versus Transfemoral Route Coronary Angiography
DOC.detailed_description: Background : PCI do traditionally transfemoral route . But transradial transbrachial route also come practice . We compare transradial versus transfemoral route ease operability , time procedure , complication , failure rate prospective study . Methods : 400 Patients admit department cardiology percutaneous intervention enrol study . 200 patient assign group randomly . A single team procedure . Pre procedure , intra procedure post procedure data patient collect , tabulate analysed properly . The variable study include Access time , Fluoroscopy time overall procedure time , post procedure complication ( ecchymosis , Thrombophelibites , Hematoma , procedure access bleed ) , Failure rate , post procedure myocardial infarction , stroke , acute renal failure infection .
DOC.criteria: diagnostic angiography coronary vessel , PCI Patients impair renal function test . Lack informed consent . Severe infection . Previous contrast allergy . Severe intrinsic/iatrogenic caogulopathy INR > 2 . Abnormal modify Allen 's test .
